English (United States)(en-US): Oh, <nickname>. Will you look at\nthis baby bird atop my head?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오, <nickname>. 내 정수리를 밟고\n서 있는 아기새를 봐 줄 수 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Well, what happened was...…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게, 그게 말이지……

English (United States)(en-US): The clouds were idly drifting away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 구름이 권태롭게 뒷짐을 지고 흘러가고 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I followed the treacherous route up the cliff\nfor a closer look and nearly lost an arm!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 깎아지르는 벼랑을 등반해,\n기필코 그에 닿아 보리라 결심했지!

English (United States)(en-US): So… you made it up on the\nwindowsill to look at the sky, [뭉치]?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어… 그러니까 창문 위에 어렵게\n올라가서 하늘을 봤다고, 뭉치야?

English (United States)(en-US): …… (조금 짜게 식은 표정)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… (조금 짜게 식은 표정)

English (United States)(en-US): Eh… That's one way to put it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다고 볼 수 있지. (통통 튀는 애니메이션)

English (United States)(en-US): And then this bird landed on\nme like she had been expecting me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 새는 기다렸다는 것처럼 나에게 내려앉았어.

English (United States)(en-US): It happened when the shadow of\nthat desk covered the floor in half,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 저 책상의 그림자가 방바닥을\n반틈 가리고 있을 때의 일인데,

English (United States)(en-US): and now darkness has set\nand she still hasn’t budged.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 완전히 어둠이 내려앉은\n지금도 떠나질 못하고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): It pains me to say it,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 침울하게 추측해 보건대, 이 새는…

English (United States)(en-US): but I think this bird is trapped in my clingy\nswamp of a body, robbed of the blue sky.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 푸늘 하늘의 자유를 포획당한 채, 내 끈끈한\n늪 같은 몸뚱이에 붙잡혀 버린 게 아닐까.

English (United States)(en-US): Death is coming for her, inch by inch. And it\nwill start with her legs twisting and rotting.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 앞닥칠 죽음을 기다리며. 천천히, 천천히,\n다리부터 뒤틀리다 썩어 가지 않을까.

English (United States)(en-US): But <nickname>, she doesn’t deserve this\nkind of pain. It will be a bleak tragedy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만, <nickname>, 그건 이 아이가 겪어선\n안 될 고통이야. 시커먼 비극이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Please, <nickname>. You have to save her!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 부탁이야, <nickname> 이 새를 구해 줘!

English (United States)(en-US): ‘But are we sure she’s trapped?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘그렇다면 큰일이긴 한데… 정말 그럴까?’

English (United States)(en-US): But doesn’t her chirping sound joyful, [뭉치]?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 것치곤 맑은 소리로\n지저귀지 않아, 뭉치야?

English (United States)(en-US): No, this is her neck-deep in the filthy\nmud, barely breathing through her beak,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 얘는 나의 진흙탕 속에 가라앉으며\n손바닥 하나만 겨우 내밀고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): frantically crying out for help. Begging\nme to please, please let her go.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 간절히 도움을 청하고 있는\n거야. 제발, 제발 놓아 달라고.

English (United States)(en-US): But it can’t be. This bird is singing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지 않아. 이 새는 노래해!

English (United States)(en-US): …… with her beak twitching in delight!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… 부리를 쫑긋거리면서 말야!

English (United States)(en-US): Is that really true, [name]?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 정말이야, [name]? (눈 동그랗게 뜨고 놀란 표정)

English (United States)(en-US): …… Really? Really?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… 정말? 정말?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, trust me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 정말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): What a mistake! I couldn't\nsee myself in the window.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오해했어! 유리창에는 내\n모습이 비치지 않는단 말야.

English (United States)(en-US): Well, her feet do seem to be sinking bit by bit,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐, 뭉치 말대로 발이 조금씩\n빠지는 것 같긴 하지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but it looks like she’s flapping\nher wings and having fun.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날갯짓하며 놀고 있는 걸로\n보여. 즐겁다는 몸짓이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Well... Well!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음… … 음! (머쓱하고 부끄러운 표정)

English (United States)(en-US): So she was singing for me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 이게 원래는 나를\n위한 음악이었단 말이지?
… (눈을 감는 뭉치)

English (United States)(en-US): How beautiful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름다워. (햅삐 뭉)

English (United States)(en-US): A voice like the finest of\nfeathers woven together.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깃털로 빚은 소리가 있다면 이런 느낌일까.

English (United States)(en-US): Bird, bird, turns out I’m safe enough for you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아기 새야! 내가 너에겐 덜 위험한 존재였나 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): I think this marks the start\nof a beautiful friendship.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다행이다. 아름다운 우정의 시작일 수 있겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): but make sure to scrub your\nfeet in the river afterwards, alright?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 나중에, 꼭 강가에 가서\n발을 깨끗이 닦아 줘야 해? 알았지?

English (United States)(en-US): Promise me. Promise me you will.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꼭, 꼭 그래야만 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Letters. It’s always better to have\nsomeone close by to read them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 편지란 건 말이야. 가까이에 읽어줄\n이가 있으면 좋다고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): How very foolish of me to think of you\nonly now—you visit me every day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 이제야 떠올린 걸까?\n매일 내 창가에 들르는 너를.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m writing this letter\nwhile staring up at you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금 널 보며 편지를 쓰고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Where I began, perhaps where\nI’ll never revisit… My Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 시초지이자, 어쩌면 이제\n영영 돌아가지 못할… 나의 달.

English (United States)(en-US): You seem unusually pale tonight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 밤의 너는 유독\n희게 질린 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder if the surrounding darkness\nis finally creeping into your light.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 테두리를 둘러싼 어둠이 기어이\n네게 침범하려 하는 걸까.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname> says that Earth is\nquite a distance away from you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>이 말해 주길, 지구는\n너와 꽤 멀리 떨어져 있대.

English (United States)(en-US): Apparently, light from here takes\none-point-three seconds to get to you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이곳의 빛이 네게 출발해도\n일 점 삼 초가 걸린다고 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): One. point. three. seconds!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 일 점 삼 초라니!

English (United States)(en-US): Four thousand stars would be born and\nthirty more would implode, with time to spare.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사천 개의 새 별이 탄생하고, 삼십 개의\n별이 폭발하고도 남는 시간이지.

English (United States)(en-US): Still, no need to be too sad.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만 너무 슬퍼하지 마.

English (United States)(en-US): Once I’m no longer a dream, once\nI become a light-like existence,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 꿈을 지나고, 빛과\n비슷한 속성의 존재가 되면…

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be with you faster\nthan the speed of light.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 빛보다 빠르게 너의 곁에 닿을게.

English (United States)(en-US): I won’t keep you lonely up there.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 홀로 뜬 네가 외롭지 않도록.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘Til we meet again.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 다시 만나자.

English (United States)(en-US): Watching monochrome films on\ncolor-filled Earth feels… endlessly quiet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 색이 가득한 지구에서 보는 흑백\n영화는 한없이 고요하게 느껴져.

English (United States)(en-US): That comfortable quiet led me\nto take a black-and-white photo.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 고요함이 왜인지 편안해서,\n이번엔 흑백 사진을 찍어 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): An Earth where only lines,\nblack, and white exist.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 선과 흑과 백만이 존재하는 지구.

English (United States)(en-US): The Earth in the photo resembled\nthe Moon up there in space.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사진 속의 지구는 우주\n속의 달과 닮아 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, as you know,\nI yearn for vivid colors.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너도 알고 있겠지만,\n나는 다채로운 색채를 갈망해.

English (United States)(en-US): I so sincerely love them and\nhow they softly paint the world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 부드럽게 세상을 물들인\n그것을 사랑해 마지않아.

English (United States)(en-US): However…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만….

English (United States)(en-US): I imagined, just for a minute,\na black-and-white world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠시 동안 상상해 봤어.\n오로지 회빛 뿐인 세상을.

English (United States)(en-US): The Dot in it seemed far less lonesome.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 안의 나는 지금보다\n훨씬 덜 외로워 보였지.

English (United States)(en-US): I know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 알아.

English (United States)(en-US): The more I love color, the more lonely\na monochrome being like me becomes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 색채를 사랑할수록 색채가 없는\n나는 더 외로워진다는 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): In spite of that, I blindly\nfeel for color endlessly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼에도 색채를 끝없이\n더듬게 되는 이유는,

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps because…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 아마도…

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): The saying ‘If you think it’s okay, it’ll be okay,’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜찮다’고 생각하면 정말로\n‘괜찮아’진다는 사실 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I think I’m successfully proving it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금 성공적으로\n실천하고 있는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Well, I think so.\nHow do I seem to you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 그렇게 생각하는데\n너는 내가 어때 보여?

English (United States)(en-US): Especially bright.|A little precarious.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 유독 밝아 보여.|조금은 위태로워 보여.

English (United States)(en-US): What?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜?

English (United States)(en-US): Are you trying to sugarcoat your words?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 듣기 좋으라고 하는 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜?

English (United States)(en-US): You can’t stand that, can you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 참아 줄 수 없어서 하는 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s not that…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 아니라…

English (United States)(en-US): It’s okay.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜찮아.

English (United States)(en-US): The world that I see with\nmy chalk-drawn eyes
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 분필 눈으로 보는 세상은

English (United States)(en-US): only has to paint my bit of the canvas.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 몫의 도화지만 꾸며 주면 그만.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m glad. It really felt like\nI had a lucky coin then.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 기꺼워. 그땐 정말 행운의\n동전이라도 가진 기분이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): So that’s how I feel now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 지금도 그래.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t take care of a drifter\nflapping his wings on my own.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날갯짓하는 나그네는 나의\n힘으로는 돌볼 수 없고

English (United States)(en-US): I make one-sided, indefinite\nplans to meet with the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달님과의 기약 없는 만남을\n일방적으로 약속하고

English (United States)(en-US): And in the end, I’m a palette\nthat pictures can’t be painted from.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결국 난 칠할 수 없는 팔레트라는 걸

English (United States)(en-US): And though I'm realizing this all\nover again for the eighty-seventh time,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 여든일곱 번째 정도\n새롭게 깨닫게 되어도

English (United States)(en-US): It’s okay. It’ll be okay.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜찮아. 다 괜찮아질 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s okay. It’s only temporary.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜찮아. 다 잠깐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s okay. It’s what I wanted.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜찮아. 다 나의 뜻대로야.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 정말이야.
